body:
Hi LucDav, Sorry for my late reply, I used this method: [http://www.srh.noaa.gov/images/epz/wxcalc/wetBulbTdFromRh.pdf](http://www.srh.noaa.gov/images/epz/wxcalc/wetBulbTdFromRh.pdf) Before to choose it, I also tried other methods, such as this one: [http://journals.ametsoc.org/doi/pdf/10.1175/JAMC-D-11-0143.1](http://journals.ametsoc.org/doi/pdf/10.1175/JAMC-D-11-0143.1) But I think the NOAA method is more complete, especially if you have 100% of RH or extreme temperature values.
If you have found some discrepancies please post them here or open a new discussion as Mostapha told you.
If you have some new formulas or methods more accurate please post the links here, so we can compare the results. Best Antonello
